WRITING.TEXT: If Joel's going to be heavily involved I can't say I'm horribly enthused. I respect him for creating the show, but imo S6-S10 is prime MST3K. I really enjoy the Joel era but I'm not pining for more of it, because Mike's tenure was more sharply written took the series in risky, fresh directions. I'm all for new content if it's good, but I dunno if I'll pledge to this. 200-something episodes is enough, anyway.

Yeah, Kevin James was great on KOQ. All of the cast did really good. Victor Williams and Patton Oswalt especially. I think its solid cast helped elevate it from "shitty generic sitcom" to something actually entertaining.

Here is a basic list of resources/hotlines that you can call if you are feeling suicidal, or are worried about someone who is. United States: 1-800-784-2433 (1-800-SUICIDE) United States (en Espanol): 1-800-SUICIDA United States-veterans 1-800-273-8255, Veterans Press 1 Europe Wide: 116 123 (free from any number) Australia: 13 11 14 Belgium: 02 649 95 55 Brasil: 141 Canada: Kids Help Phone (under 18 free counseling) 1-800-668-6868 http://www.suicidepreventionlifeline.org/ 1-800-273-TALK (8255) Quebec http://www.cpsquebec.ca/ 1 866 APPELLE (1 866 277-3553) Ontario http://www.ospn.ca/ Or call Call 211 Manitoba http://www.reasontolive.ca/ 1-877-435-7170 Saskatchewan http://www.health.gov.sk.ca/understanding-depression-and-suicide or call 211 Alberta http://suicideinfo.ca/ http://www.albertahealthservices.ca/2738.asp 403-245-3900 British Columbia http://crisiscentre.bc.ca/ 1-800-SUICIDE (1-800-784-2433) Nova Scotia http://novascotia.ca/dhw/healthy-communities/suicide-prevention.asp 1-888-429-8167 (toll free) New Brunswick http://www.gnb.ca/0055/index-e.asp Tele-care/Tl-soins: 8-1-1 CHIMO helpline: 1-800-667-5005 Kids Help Phone: 1-800-668-6868 Prince Edward Island http://pei.cmha.ca/programs-and-services/suicide-prevention/ 1-800-218-2885.
